intro: Carissa wyliei, commonly known as the Wylie’s moonvine, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 4 meters in height, with thick, woody stems and glossy, dark green leaves. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer, followed by orange-red berries. Its botanical features include opposite leaf arrangement and a distinctive, showy inflorescence. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
